description: The number m such that A003251(m) = A003231(n).
comments: This is the function named lambda in [Carlitz]. - _Eric M. Schmidt_, Aug 14 2014
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: L. Carlitz, R. Scoville and T. Vaughan, Some arithmetic functions related to Fibonacci numbers, Fib. Quart., 11 (1973), 337-386.
formula: a(n) = 3n - j(n), where j(n) is the maximum number such that j(n) <= A003249(n). [Carlitz, Theorem 7.15]. - _Eric M. Schmidt_, Aug 17 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Sequence corrected and extended by, and definition from _Eric M. Schmidt_, Aug 17 2014
